definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
lane (usually as part of a street name)/memorial archway
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Once upon a time there was a miller. He lived contentedly with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 從前，有位磨坊主和妻子生活在一塊，生活十分富足。

sentences.english: Every miller draws water to his own mill.
sentences.chinese: 磨坊主都往自己磨裏注水。

sentences.english: As soon as winter was over and the primroses began to bloom, the Miller went to visit little Hans.
sentences.chinese: 冬天一過，櫻草花剛一開，磨坊主就去看望小漢斯了。
於是穆那查到了磨坊主那裏。

sentences.english: The miller had invited all his relatives and acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 磨坊主邀請了他所有的親朋好友。

sentences.english: Obviously the millers in Europe would have an incentive to switch their business from European to American farmers.
sentences.chinese: 顯然歐洲磨坊主會有把生意從歐洲向美國轉移的打算。

sentences.english: The situation would be reversed for millers based in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 而情況對於歐洲的磨坊主則正好相反。

sentences.english: The miller came running in his nightshirt.
sentences.chinese: 磨坊主穿着睡衣就跑了出來。

sentences.english: He had known the miller's wife for years, had even bedded her.
sentences.chinese: 他已經認識磨坊主的妻子多年了，甚至睡過她。

sentences.english: When she came of age he wished that she was provided for and well married.
sentences.chinese: 當她到結婚的年齡是磨坊主希望女兒能找個好人家。

sentences.english: The miller's daughter sits and spins.
sentences.chinese: 磨坊主女兒一個人在織毛衣。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
